entry.title: Jonathan Allen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jonathan Allen (pictured) left journalism for politics before quitting 40 days later?

entry.title: Dvorichna settlement hromada (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Dvorichna settlement hromada has remained divided between Russia and Ukraine since the 2022 Kharkiv counteroffensive?

entry.title: Chanig ar Gall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chanig ar Gall joined her husband Charlez ar Gall in Breton-language broadcasting after learning the language itself?

entry.title: Darl+ing (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that South Korean band Seventeen partnered with Apple to let fans create remixes of their song "Darl+ing" on GarageBand?

entry.title: 2023 Leagues Cup final (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that tickets on secondary markets for the 2023 Leagues Cup final ranged from $484 to $12,000 within a day of release?

entry.title: a mural (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 13 contemporary Dubliners reenacted The Last Supper by Leonardo da Vinci for a mural installed in their city's "Italian Quarter"?

entry.title: Chaimas Kaplanas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chaimas Kaplanas took part in four hunger strikes during his imprisonment at Kaunas Prison?

entry.title: The Sims 2: Nightlife (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a reviewer for The Sims 2: Nightlife said that a more accurate name would be "The Sims: Slutting About"?
